title: The Science (and Art) of Sex
description:
A candid, educational exploration of sex through the lenses of biology, psychology, and connection. This course features expert interviews with board-certified physicians, licensed therapists, PhDs, and specialized practitionersâ€”ensuring every episode delivers credible, science-backed information.

Learn from world-renowned relationship psychotherapist Esther Perel, sex educator and PhD Emily Nagoski (author of 'Come As You Are'), board-certified urologists specializing in sexual medicine, pelvic floor physical therapists, AASECT-certified sex therapists, and menopause specialists at the forefront of hormone research.

Beginner episodes feature accessible experts who reduce shame and build foundational knowledge about intimacy, desire, and communication. Intermediate episodes provide technical depth on sexual health, pelvic anatomy, and clinical treatments from domain experts. Advanced episodes explore cutting-edge research on hormones, innovative pleasure techniques, and the latest treatments for sexual dysfunction.

Through these expert-guided conversations, you'll understand the neuroscience of desire, learn evidence-based approaches to common concerns, discover how to communicate about sex without shame, and gain tools for healthier, more satisfying intimate relationships at every stage of life. This course demystifies sexuality with equal attention to rigorous science and human empathy.
